abstract: The question was repeatedly rejected by Chief Justice John G. Roberts Jr. on Wednesday because it would identify the C.I.A. whistle-blower.
lead_paragraph: Senator Rand Paul, Republican of Kentucky, will insist on Thursday that Chief Justice John G. Roberts Jr. read aloud his question on the origins of the impeachment inquiry, a day after the question was repeatedly rejected because it would name the C.I.A. whistle-blower who first raised concerns about President Trumpâ€™s actions toward Ukraine.
